meta.title: COVID CareLine

li.a: For Deaf and Hard of Hearing
About Mental Health and Addiction Treatment

span.span: Health Professionals / About Mental Health and Addiction Treatment / Emergency Preparedness / Coronavirus / COVID CareLine

div.p: The COVID CareLine is a new, toll-free number and emotional support call service created by the Ohio Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services. Behavioral health professionals will staff the CareLine from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m., 7 days/week. They will offer confidential support in times of personal crisis when individuals may be struggling to cope with current challenges in their lives. After 8 p.m., the CareLine will forward to the National Suicide Prevention Helpline, allowing those calling to have access to someone 24 hours/day.
* Enter Your First & Last Name Separated By Underscore (ex. John_Smith): (optional)
